alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 04 at 2:42PM AKST until February 06 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills occuring. Blowing snow with low visibility expected. Plan on areas of poor visibilities to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...3 PM today to noon Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow. Cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. The cold wind chills are now occuring and will continue into Sunday. The stronger winds and blowing snow will develop on Saturday afternoon and continue into Sunday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means periods of blowing snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
